intro: Ruellia domatiata, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Ruellia domatiata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners in tropical and subtropical regions.
